title: Recreate Logo as Editable Vector in Inks
Lead Manager
description:
Cash Now Philly closes over 100 deals a year across Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, and Maryland. We're not a startup figuring things out ‚Äî we're a proven operation looking for two Follow-Up Managers to join our acquisitions team.

This role is all about lead reactivation. You'll be working through our CRM database of homeowners, identifying motivation, and setting up quality conversations for our acquisition reps. If you're comfortable in high-volume phone environments and know how to turn a "not interested" into a real conversation, this could be a great fit.



What the job looks like day-to-day:

Working in a predictive dialer (Salesforce, Zen Call) making hundreds of calls per day

Reactivating aged leads and identifying homeowners who are actually motivated to sell

Handling objections and keeping conversations moving forward

Logging detailed notes and dispositions in the CRM

Handing off real opportunities to our acquisition team with solid context



Who we're looking for:

At least 2 years of cold calling or outbound sales experience

Clear English communication ‚Äî you'll be talking to homeowners across the US

Someone who can sit in a dialer queue all day and stay sharp

You listen more than you talk and know how to find motivation without being pushy

Real estate experience is a plus but not required ‚Äî we'll train the right person



What we offer:

$5/hour base pay

Full-time, Monday through Friday, 9 AM to 7 PM Eastern

Fully remote

Training from a team that actually closes deals

A tight ship without micromanagement ‚Äî show up, do the work, get better every day



How to apply:

We take hiring seriously. Expect a questionnaire, an assessment, and an interview. Don't copy/paste some generic application ‚Äî we read every one. Include the code word "reactivate" somewhere in your submission.

If you're ready to work with a real team that performs, apply now.

title: Graphic Designer and Video Editor
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled Graphic & Video Designer to support our content team with brand-aligned creatives and video editing.



This role requires strong attention to detail, fast execution (1‚Äì2 business days), and the ability to work within structured brand guidelines.

title: **TOP TIER Accounting  & QBO Specialist**
description:
**PLEASE do not contact us in any other way except this posting (No LinkedIn requests, e-mails, calls, etc.)**

**Must send a resume AND a cover letter explaining how you are a good fit for this job and what relevant experience you have ****

**Voice samples are not required but are appreciated**

** NO AGENCIES - WE ONLY WORK DIRECTLY WITH FREELANCERS **

____________________________________________________________________________________________



We are a consulting company based out of New Jersey, USA who provide accounting & other services to our clients. 



We specialize in real estate investing and are looking for someone with direct experience in that area. 



We are hiring for a long-term position. The right candidate will have great attention to detail, can work independently, and is interested in making the business better.



There are opportunities for raises & growth for the right candidate. We really would like someone who can learn quickly and will take a proactive approach to constantly make things better, without being asked.



GOOD or GREAT American/neutral accent is preferred, someone who is familiar with the US work culture or has worked for a US company before.



We accommodate someone that can work 20-40 hours a week, with the opportunity to become full-time + a pay increase consideration annually.



The secret word is watermelon. If you include the word ‚Äúwatermelon‚Äù along with your job application, you can guarantee we will look at it. If you do not, we will discard your application. By letting us know the secret word, we know that you‚Äôve read this job post in full and have high attention to detail.



The working hours are 9:00 ‚Äì 5:00pm (flexible), based on EST (UTC -5). Any breaks taken are unpaid.



There is an opportunity to learn and grow into new tasks which may lead to more pay increases in the future.

____________________________________________________________________________________________





Tasks include:



- Accounts Payable/Receivable: Invoicing clients, tracking payments, managing vendor bills

- Assisting with the creation of bank financing packages utilizing existing Excel templates

- Tax support: Issue/collect 1099s, prepare financials and documents as needed for year end tax process.

-Assist tenants with payment methods, process payments, and manage any payment-related inquiries.

- Process payroll and perform other data entry tasks

 Assist team with developing internal accounting strategy as well as strategy for clients 

- Continuously update company records and CRM/property management software with the latest information 

- File & document organization, Excel projects, creating and editing PDFs

- Pulling information from local government websites

- Occasionally calling & faxing utility companies to set up/remove service

- Other tasks as needed





Attributes:



- Quick learner

- Ability to take constructive criticism & feedback and improve on it

- Experience working in US company / US work culture

- Punctual, on time, responsive



Skills Required:



- Expert in Quickbooks 

- Comfortable on phone & meetings speaking English

- Working knowledge / license in different accounting software (QBO, Xero, Buildium, AppFolio, 
)

- Dropbox, Google Drive or shared drive experience

- MS Office Suite + PDF

- Fast, consistent internet connection

- Docusign, Dotloop, or other document preparation software

- Experience with CRM Software (Asana, Podio, HubSpot, etc.) 



Skills Preferred / Nice to Have



- Currently utilizes AI tools / agents to perform job  

- Experience with property management software 

- General knowledge of US real estate

- Experience working with US municipal / city offices

- Experience working with a real estate agent or broker

title: Remote VA Receptionist (Immediate Hire | 24-Hour Review)
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: OPERATIONS MANAGER ‚Äì ECOMMERCE (FULL TIME)
description:
We operate a high-volume ecommerce dropshipping business across multiple products and markets.



The business is growing. Each department now has a lead. KPIs and reporting exist. Output is strong.



What we need now is not growth generation.



We need structure, stability, and operational control.



We are looking for an Operations Manager to protect and strengthen the backend of the business so founders can focus on strategic growth.



ROLE OBJECTIVE



Your role is defensive and structural.



You are responsible for making sure:

- The machine runs smoothly

- Departments stay aligned

- KPIs are tracked and acted upon

- Reporting gives clarity (not noise)

- Systems are organized and scalable

- Nothing breaks operationally



You are not responsible for generating revenue.

You are responsible for protecting and optimizing operations.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



‚Ä¢ Oversee daily operations across departments (Creative, Media Buying, CS, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Improve and standardize KPI tracking and EOD reporting

‚Ä¢ Redesign reporting formats to provide clear visibility for founders

‚Ä¢ Build and structure a proper project management system (ClickUp or equivalent)

‚Ä¢ Organize SOPs into a centralized, scalable system

‚Ä¢ Identify inefficiencies and fix them

‚Ä¢ Implement workflow automations when relevant

‚Ä¢ Monitor execution discipline and accountability

‚Ä¢ Handle operational issues and urgent situations when needed

‚Ä¢ Support onboarding of new tea
mbers

‚Ä¢ Ensure bonus/KPI logic is applied consistently



WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR



Hard Skills:

- Proven experience in ecommerce operations (agency or high-volume store preferred)

- Strong understanding of performance marketing structure

- Advanced Google Sheets / Excel

- Dashboard creation & KPI modeling

- Workflow optimization

- Experience building systems (ClickUp, Notion, Asana, etc.)

- Comfortable managing remote teams



Soft Skills:

- Calm under pressure

- Structured thinker

- High ownership mentality

- Strong problem solver

- Direct communicator

- Emotionally stable

- Able to handle responsibility without drama



THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR:



- Beginners

- Pure project managers without ecommerce experience

- People who need constant supervision

- People who avoid hard conversations

- People looking for a ‚Äúchill‚Äù job



COMPENSATION



Monthly compensation: $1,600 ‚Äì $2,200 depending on experience and operational maturity.



Long-term growth and increased compensation possible based on performance and responsibility.



This is a long-term role.



WORK STRUCTURE



Full-time

Remote

Flexible structure, but high accountability



HOW TO APPLY



1. Change your
 subject to:

   Let's build the machine



2. Send your CV



3. (Optional but highly recommended) Loom video explaining:

   - What you would improve first in a 7-figure ecommerce operation

   - How you structure KPIs across multiple departments

   - One operational mistake you‚Äôve seen ecommerce founders make



Only applications that follow the instructions will be reviewed.



If you are highly structured, operationally strong, and want to build something long-term, apply.

title: Accounting Support (Tax Experience)
description:

This role supports a growing events and hospitality business with multiple income streams and Schedule C entities.

The primary goal of this role is to keep the books clean, organized, and tax-ready, so year-end filings and CPA handoffs are smooth and stress-free. You will work closely with the owners and coordinate with external tax professionals as needed.



Key Responsibilities

Tax Preparation & Readiness

‚Ä¢ Maintain clear records and documentation to support:

o Annual income tax filings

o CPA or tax preparer reviews

‚Ä¢ Assist with preparing year-end summaries and reports for tax filing

‚Ä¢ Support communication with the CPA by providing requested reports or clarifications



Reporting & Organization



‚Ä¢ Prepare basic financial reports as needed (P&L, income summaries, expense breakdowns)

‚Ä¢ Track income by job, event, or category using existing internal methods

‚Ä¢ Maintain organized digital records for receipts, invoices, and payroll documents

‚Ä¢ Communicate proactively when issues may impact tax accuracy or deadlines

‚Ä¢ 

Required Qualifications



‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì3 years of bookkeeping or accounting experience, preferably with small businesses

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of expense categorization and reconciliations

‚Ä¢ Experience with Wave, QuickBooks, or similar accounting software

Nice to Have

‚Ä¢ CPA, or advanced accounting background

title: Revenue Operations Lead
description:
SmartRecover is a human-powered SMS lead recovery service for healthcare and DTC brands. When leads abandon checkouts or forms, our team reaches out via SMS‚Äîsupported by AI‚Äîto answer questions and guide them to conversion.



As Revenue Operations Manager, you own the systems and outcomes that drive revenue. You will improve our AI so it handles more conversations well, build and refine internal and external tooling to scale the team, and make our marketing and recovery engine more efficient. You run new client onboarding, optimize existing clients by improving how AI and humans work together, and own the metrics that matter: conversion rate, automation, and quality. You report to the founder and work alongside the operations team.



Job Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Improve AI product  quality and increase the share of conversations handled accurately. 



‚Ä¢ Build and improve internal and external tooling to support the team and scale operations. 



‚Ä¢ Make the marketing and recovery engine more efficient (conversion, flow, and quality). 



‚Ä¢ Run new client onboarding: turn client materials into documentation, training, and AI behavior that converts. 



‚Ä¢ Optimize existing clients by tuning how AI and reps work together and fixing what‚Äôs broken. 



‚Ä¢ Own and report on revenue and funnel metrics (conversion rate, automation %, errors). 



‚Ä¢ Document processes and create playbooks so the team can repeat what works. 



‚Ä¢ Train and align the operations team on systems and how to support optimization.





Job Requirements

‚Ä¢ Comfortable learning and using tools, workflows, and data to improve outcomes.  



‚Ä¢ Understanding of sales and conversion; can tell when a conversation or funnel is on- or off-track.  



‚Ä¢ Self-directed and proactive; proposes and implements solutions, not just problems.  



‚Ä¢ Clear written and verbal communication; can explain systems and changes to different audiences.  



‚Ä¢ Fluent in English (written and spoken).  



‚Ä¢ Nice to have: experience with AI or prompt design; background in RevOps, sales ops, or customer success; familiarity with healthcare or DTC.



Please submit a short Loom video (2‚Äì3 minutes) as part of your application here:

Relevant ‚Äî connect your story to this role (revenue, systems, conversion, or AI/operations).

title: Executive Business Specialist
description:
About the Role:

We are looking for a high-speed, proactive Virtual Assistant to help launch and scale our online fitness program: The Garage Dad Blueprint. You won't just be doing admin; you will be the "execution engine" of our business growth.

Your Primary Mission:

Accelerated Learning & Execution: You will be tasked with going through an elite online business course (The Propane Course) at breakneck speed. You need to absorb the strategies and implement them immediately to hit our business milestones.

Social Media Growth: Create and post engaging content (Instagram focus) that resonates with "Busy Dads." You should be skilled at making posts that stop the scroll and start conversations.

Validation & Outreach: Help us secure our first 3-4 paying clients through direct outreach, lead tracking, and managing the validation process.

Platform Setup: Assist with setting up coaching "buckets" in the Everfit app and ensuring a smooth client experience.

Requirements:

Speed is everything: You move fast, learn fast, and execute faster.

Top-tier English: Excellent written communication skills are a must.

Social Media Native: You understand what makes an engaging post and how to use IG/Facebook for business.

Self-Starter: You don‚Äôt wait for a checklist. You see what needs to be done based on the course roadmap and you do it.

Fitness Interest: An interest in health and fitness is a big plus.



ABOUT FA FITNESS

FA Fitness is a health and fitness company providing personalized training solutions for busy dads. We specialize in science-based, time-efficient workout programs that deliver real results without the traditional gym constraints. Our flagship program, The Garage Dad Blueprint, helps time-poor dads regain their strength, energy, and confidence through structured 30-minute workouts.

Website: 



POSITION SUMMARY

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Growth Assistant & Course Executor to join our team during a critical validation and growth phase. This role requires exceptional speed of execution, strong organizational skills, and the ability to independently manage multiple workstreams including course completion, client onboarding, and social media management.

The ideal candidate will serve as the operational backbone for our client acquisition strategy, working at "breakneck speed" to help us validate our core offering with 3-4 initial paying clients, then scale rapidly toward our target of 250 group training members.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Course Execution & Client Validation (Primary Focus)

Complete and execute the Propane course methodology to acquire and onboard 3-4 validation clients for The Garage Dad Blueprint program

Manage all aspects of client onboarding process, including communications, program setup, and initial touchpoints

Document processes, results, and learnings from validation phase for future scaling

Ensure seamless client experience from first contact through program enrollment

Coordinate with Director on client progress and feedback

Social Media Management

Plan, create, and schedule social media content across Instagram and other platforms

Develop engaging posts that align with FA Fitness brand voice (motivational, evidence-based, anti-fluff)

Monitor engagement metrics and respond to comments/DMs promptly

Implement content strategies focused on busy dads, professionals, and parents

Create content featuring bold text overlays on moody equipment backgrounds (per current brand guidelines)

Execute "hand-raiser" campaigns and direct outreach strategies for client acquisition

Operations & Execution

Work with urgency and speed to meet aggressive growth timelines

Manage Everfit platform setup for new clients (training provided)

Maintain organized systems for client tracking, communications, and program delivery

Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions proactively

Support preparation for scaling to 250-client group training model



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Proven track record of fast execution and meeting tight deadlines

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (professional level)

Experience with social media management (Instagram essential)

Highly organized with strong attention to detail

Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision

Comfortable learning new software platforms quickly (Everfit, scheduling tools, etc.)

Reliable internet connection and professional home workspace

Available to work during UK business hours or flexible schedule that overlaps with Europe/London timezone



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Previous experience in fitness, health, or wellness industry

Familiarity with course execution methodologies or client acquisition strategies

Experience with content creation tools (Canva, scheduling platforms, video editing)

Understanding of fitness terminology and training concepts

Experience with CRM systems or client management platforms

Background in customer service or client success roles



COMPETENCIES & ATTRIBUTES

Speed & urgency: Ability to move fast without sacrificing quality

Problem-solver: Resourceful and solutions-oriented mindset

Clear communicator: Able to articulate ideas and updates concisely

Process-driven: Creates systems and follows through consistently

Adaptable: Comfortable with evolving priorities in a growing business

Coachable: Open to feedback and willing to learn new approaches



WORK ARRANGEMENT

Remote position (work from home)

Philippines-based candidates strongly preferred

Flexible hours with requirement for some overlap with UK timezone (Europe/London)

Fast-paced startup environment requiring rapid iteration and execution

Direct reporting relationship with Company Director



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Competitive salary commensurate with experience 

Performance-based incentives tied to client acquisition milestones

Opportunity for growth as company scales

Work-from-home flexibility

Training and professional development in fitness industry and digital marketing



APPLICATION PROCESS

To apply, please submit:

Current CV/Resume highlighting relevant experience

Cover letter (maximum 300 words) answering:

Subject in CV must include the word SPEED or you CV will be ignored. 

Why you're excited about this role

Examples of projects where you executed at speed

Your experience with social media or client-facing work

Portfolio or examples of social media content you've created (if applicable)

Expected Start Date: Immediate / As soon as possible



EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

FA Fitness is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.



FA Fitness

Empowering busy people to reclaim their strength, energy, and confidence.

This job description is subject to change and may be amended at the company's discretion to reflect evolving business needs.

title: Workflow Engineer (Automation Platform)
description:
Remote ‚Äì Philippines

USD $2,000 ‚Äì $3,000 per month



About Triggr



Triggr is a 100% done-for-you automation platform for Managed Service Providers (MSPs).



Our customers do not build workflows themselves. We design, build, test, and maintain automations on their behalf ‚Äî primarily around Microsoft 365 and MSP operational systems.



We are building a serious automation platform with:

-a structured workflow engine

-reusable automation templates

-and an emerging AI-assisted workflow builder



This is not a scripting side-project. This is production software.

________________________________________________________________________________________________



About the Role



We are hiring a Workflow Engineer with a strong engineering mindset to build automation workflows end-to-end and help evolve our internal tooling ‚Äî including contributing to our workflow builder AI.



This role is for someone who:

-thinks in logic, systems, and failure modes

-is comfortable reading and writing real code

-prefers correctness over shortcuts

-can work independently from clear specifications



This is not an IT support role, and not a low-code ‚Äúautomation specialist‚Äù position.

__________________________________________________________________________

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For



Core Engineering Work:

-Build automation workflows end-to-end from structured tickets

-Implement:

-triggers

-actions

-branching logic

-retries and idempotency

-failure handling and rollback logic

-Integrate with third-party APIs and internal services

-Write and reason about JavaScript-based workflow logic

-Test workflows against real-world edge cases

-Debug failed or partial executions

-Document assumptions and technical decisions clearly

________________________________________________________________________

Engineering Quality & Systems Thinking:

-Identify incomplete or unsafe specifications before building

-Push back on unclear requirements instead of guessing

-Propose more robust or maintainable implementations

-Think about workflows as long-lived systems, not one-off builds

-Improve internal patterns, templates, and primitives

_________________________________________________________________________

Platform & AI Tooling (Growing Responsibility):

-Contribute to improving our internal workflow builder

-Help define how automation logic is represented and validated

-Assist in training and shaping our AI-assisted workflow builder

-Provide engineering feedback on what should or should not be automated



This is a chance to influence how automation is built, not just build it.

_______________________________________________________________________

Collaboration:

-Work closely with the Account Manager and founder

-Participate in technical reviews

-Occasionally join client calls to clarify technical details (not sales)

-Prepare internal notes to support workflow demos

_______________________________________________________________________

What You Will NOT Do:

You will not provide end-user IT support

You will not guess or ‚Äúfill in gaps‚Äù in requirements

You will not promise outcomes directly to clients

You will not build fragile or untested automations



Reliability and correctness matter more than speed.

____________________________________________________________________

Required Experience & Skills



Must Have:

-Strong engineering background

-Experience building production-grade systems, integrations, or automation

-JavaScript experience (strongly preferred)

(used for workflow logic, conditions, transformations)

-Comfort working with:

-APIs (REST, authentication, pagination, rate limits)

-structured data (JSON)

-conditional logic and branching

-retries, idempotency, and error handling

-Ability to reason about edge cases and failure scenarios

-Strong written English for technical documentation and async communication

___________________________________________________________________________

Strongly Preferred:

-Experience with automation platforms or workflow engines

-Microsoft 365 / Entra ID experience

-MSP ecosystem familiarity

-Experience with PSA / RMM systems (ConnectWise, Halo, Ninja, Datto, etc.)

-Experience contributing to internal tools or developer platforms

-Experience working from detailed technical specs or tickets

__________________________________________________________________

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

-Thinks like an engineer, not a technician

-Comfortable saying ‚Äúthis design is unsafe‚Äù

-Values clarity, correctness, and maintainability

-Calm, methodical problem solver

-Can work independently without constant supervision

-Enjoys building systems that other people rely on

___________________________________________________________________

Compensation:

USD $2,500 ‚Äì $3,000 per month

Fully remote

Long-term role

Paid technical trial period

______________________________________________________________________

How to Apply



 your application to:

???? 



Please include:

1. Your CV

2. A GitHub profile or code samples

-(repositories, gists, or examples of real code you‚Äôve written)

3. A short technical write-up (bullet points are fine) covering:

-A system, integration, or automation you built

-The hardest technical problem you faced

-How you handled errors, retries, or edge cases

4. Your expected monthly compensation in USD



Applications without code samples or technical detail will not be considered.

______________________________________________________________

Screening Process

1. CV + code review

2. Technical design / reasoning task

3. Short engineering interview

4. Paid trial task

______________________________________________________________

Why This Role Exists



This role exists to:

1. remove execution bottlenecks

2. raise engineering quality

3. improve automation reliability

4. help build the next generation of our workflow platform



If you enjoy real engineering, not ticket firefighting, this role is for you.

title: Customer Service Operations Manager (eCommerce)
description:
FULL-TIME, LONG-TERM, EXCLUSIVE ROLE ONLY

No part-time work, agency setups, or side commitments.



We are a fast-growing supplement brand looking for a Customer Support Manager who is genuinely obsessed with efficiency and continuous improvement. This is not a role for someone who just wants to maintain the status quo or follow a manual. We need a leader who looks at a process and immediately thinks of three ways to make it faster, smarter, and better.

You will be responsible for building and scaling our support operations. We want someone who takes deep pride in ownership, turns chaos into systems, and ensures our customer experience is a competitive advantage. If you are a builder who thrives on fixing broken workflows and implementing high-level strategy, we want to talk to you.



What You Will Do



* Optimize & Implement: You will be the architect of our CS roadmap, constantly auditing and improving systems to ensure we stay ahead of our growth.

* System Ownership: Beyond just managing tickets, you will create, improve, and maintain our entire library of SOPs, macros, and internal documentation.

* Problem Identification: You will proactively identify patterns in customer friction and work across departments to solve issues at the root.

* Tech Stack Management: Take full ownership of our tools (Gorgias, Shopify, etc.), ensuring all automations, rules, and integrations are running at peak performance.

* Accountability: Own the department KPIs (CSAT, Resolution Time, Efficiency) and use data to drive every decision you make.

* Hiring: Hire, promote, and remove underperformers to maintain a high-output, accountable team culture

* Lead by Example: Set the standard for communication and problem-solving, eventually leading the hiring and training as the team scales.



Qualifications



* 5+ years leading customer service teams of 15+ in a fast-paced eCommerce environment

* Obsession with Improvement: You must be able to demonstrate how you have personally improved a system, workflow, or department in a previous role.

* Shopify Expert: Strong hands-on experience with Shopify and its ecosystem of apps.

* Tool Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar platforms, specifically in building out automations and complex workflows.

* Strategic Thinker: Ability to translate raw data into actionable process changes.

* Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English with the ability to lead with authority and clarity.

* Commitment: Willingness to commit full-time and exclusively to our brand for the long term.



This Role is Not for You If:



* You view this as "just a job" rather than something you take personal pride in building

* You need step-by-step direction and shy away from strategic decisions

* You're uncomfortable holding people accountable or addressing underperformance

* You present problems instead of solving them

* You want a comfortable, predictable 9-to-5 job



Click here to apply :

customer-support-manager

mber to complement our services.

title: Video Editor for Paid Ads (Meta, TikTok, UGC, D2C Brand)
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing direct response video ads for Meta 
/Instagram) and TikTok.



We work with a creative engine: every week our creators produce raw content, and we test multiple variations to find winners. We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You‚Äôll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will be our dedicated Video Editor for performance ads. Your job is to turn raw creator content into multiple high-converting ad variations for Meta & TikTok on a weekly basis.



This is NOT basic video editing.

We are looking for someone who understands direct response marketing and knows how to edit videos that convert.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Edit 5‚Äì15 short-form ad videos per week (UGC + lifestyle + product demos)

- Create multiple variations from the same raw footage (different hooks, captions, pacing, first 3 seconds, CTAs)

- Add subtitles optimized for TikTok & Meta (fast, bold, attention-grabbing)

- Cut for retention: strong hooks in the first 1‚Äì3 seconds

- Follow our creative briefs, examples, and SOP

- Deliver on time every week

- Implement feedback and iterate on winning creatives

- Organize files properly (naming, folders, versions)



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has experience editing direct response / performance ads

- Understands how ads work on Meta & TikTok (hooks, pacing, scroll-stopping edits)

- Is detail-oriented and follows instructions carefully

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Can work independently once the SOP is clear

- Can handle weekly production without reminders



Important

We work fast and test a lot of creatives.

If you:

- Miss deadlines

- Don‚Äôt follow instructions

- Don‚Äôt ask questions when confused

- Or deliver inconsistent quality

title: Microsoft 365 & Azure Systems Administrator (RMM + Windows Support)
description:
We are seeking a skilled and reliable Microsoft 365 & Azure Systems Administrator to join our team. This role requires strong experience supporting Microsoft 365 environments, working with Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) tools, and providing Level 2 and Level 3 technical support for Windows desktop users. The ideal candidate will have strong English communication skills, stable internet, and the ability to work North American Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.



Key Responsibilities:

- Provide Level 2 and Level 3 technical support for Windows desktop systems (Windows 10/11), including troubleshooting hardware, software, performance, connectivity, and user issues.

- Administer and support Microsoft 365 services including Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Intune, and Entra ID (Azure AD).

- Support and maintain Microsoft Azure environments, including basic cloud administration and troubleshooting.

- Use RMM tools (such as NinjaOne or similar) to perform remote monitoring, patch management, scripting, automation, endpoint management, and proactive issue resolution.

- Manage user accounts, permissions, licensing, MFA, security policies, and access controls.

- Assist with onboarding/offboarding users, workstation deployments, and configuration of new devices.

- Support antivirus and endpoint security tools and apply security best practices.

- Document troubleshooting steps, configurations, and internal processes clearly.

- Escalate and collaborate with senior technical teams when required.



Required Qualifications:

- Experience providing Level 2 and Level 3 technical support for Windows desktops in a business environment.

- Strong experience supporting Microsoft 365 environments.

- Experience working with RMM tools (NinjaOne experience is an asset, but any RMM tool experience is acceptable).

- Microsoft certification required (Microsoft 365 MS-900)

- Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to work independently.

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills.

- Reliable high-speed internet connection.

- Must be able to work North American Eastern Standard Time (EST) business hours.



Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):

- Microsoft Azure certification.

- Microsoft Azure AZ-900 certification.

- Experience with Intune device management and Microsoft security best practices.

- Experience working in an MSP environment.



Work Requirements:

- Remote role.

- Must be available during North American Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.

- Must have strong English communication skills and stable internet access.



Application Instructions:

- Applicants must provide their CV/resume in PDF format and Microsoft Word format (.doc or .docx).

- Applications missing either format will not be considered.

title: Graphic Design | Social Media | Content Creation | Branding
description:
Company: MedSpeak AI (
)

Hours: Part-Time, 15‚Äì20 hours/week (flexible schedule)

Pay: $3-$6 an hour depending on skillset

Bonuses: There will be many opportunities for you to make big bonuses when marketing material is delivered at a high quality.



About Us

MedSpeak AI is a growing tech company that builds AI-powered communication and automation solutions for healthcare practices across the United States ‚Äî including medical spas (mainly med spas), dental offices, and chiropractic clinics. We help our clients boost their communication via AI voice agents and reduce missed opportunities.



We're looking for a self-driven, talented graphic designer to own our brand presence, sales materials, and content creation. This is not a role where you wait to be told what to do ‚Äî this is a role where you take the wheel. We will have some specific projects, but if not, you will be in charge of creating.



How This Role Works



We will provide you with:

Access to all tools (Canva Pro, AI tools, etc.)

Brand assets, content, talking points, and company information

Clear context on who we are, what we do, and who we serve

Specific projects when we have them



What we expect from you:



When we assign a specific project, you execute it at a high level with minimal hand-holding

When there are no specific projects, you don't sit idle ‚Äî you create. You look at our social media, our website, our sales materials, and you identify what's missing, what could be better, and what new content would move the needle. Then you build it.

You communicate proactively. If you need something, you ask. If you have an idea, you share it. If something is unclear, you speak up ‚Äî you don't wait.

You treat our brand like it's your own



This role is a bad fit if you need constant direction, prefer to only work from a checklist, or wait for someone to tell you what to do next. We need someone who sees a gap and fills it without being asked.



What You'll Be Doing:

Brand & Design Work



Design pitch decks, sales presentations, and proposals that look polished and premium ‚Äî not templated

Create and maintain brand boards, style guides, and brand mockups for MedSpeak

Develop branded slide templates and marketing collateral that reflect a clean, sophisticated aesthetic

Ensure visual consistency across all materials



Marketing & Social Media Content



Design social media graphics (Instagram,
, LinkedIn) ‚Äî posts, carousels, stories, and ads

Create one-pagers, flyers, case studies, and
 graphics

Repurpose our existing written content and talking points into visually engaging assets

Independently develop content calendars and propose new content ideas to strengthen our online presence



AI-Assisted Content Creation



Use AI content creation tools (Higgsfield, Canva AI, etc.) to accelerate design workflows

Stay current with AI design tools and suggest ways to improve our content pipeline

Combine AI-generated elements with original design work for a polished final product



Self-Directed Work (This Is Key)



Audit our existing materials and proactively identify areas for improvement

Create new sales collateral, social posts, or brand assets on your own initiative when no specific task is assigned

Bring ideas to the table ‚Äî don't wait for us to think of everything

Manage your own time and priorities effectively without daily oversight





What We're Looking For

Must-Haves



Strong proficiency in Canva (this is our primary design tool)

Proven experience creating pitch decks, branded presentations, and marketing materials

Strong eye for branding, layout, typography, and color theory

Experience designing social media content across multiple platforms

Ability to take written content/copy and turn it into compelling visual assets

Familiarity with AI content creation tools (Canva AI, Higgsfield, Midjourney, or similar)

Portfolio that demonstrates clean, modern, premium design ‚Äî not generic template work

Self-starter mentality ‚Äî you can show examples of work you created on your own initiative, not just work that was assigned to you

Strong communication skills and comfort working independently with minimal supervision



Nice-to-Haves



Experience with brand identity development (logos, brand boards, style guides)

Experience creating content for B2B or healthcare/tech companies

Understanding of direct response marketing and conversion-focused design

Video editing or motion graphics skills (Canva video, CapCut, etc.)





What Success Looks Like



You receive a project ? you deliver it at a high level without needing multiple rounds of revision

You have no assigned project ? you create something valuable anyway and share it with us

Our pitch decks close deals because they look and feel premium

Our social media presence is consistent, professional, and generates engagement

Brand materials are cohesive ‚Äî everything looks like it belongs to the same company

We hear from you regularly with updates, ideas, and questions ‚Äî not silence

Turnaround is fast and quality is high because you leverage AI tools effectively

title: Senior PPC Account Manager
description:
ROLE SUMMARY



The Account Manager (AM) is a client-facing role responsible for supporting day-to-day success across a portfolio of marketing accounts. AMs work closely with internal teams to keep projects moving, ensure the timely delivery of campaigns and assets, and maintain strong client communication. They act as the central point of coordination, translating client needs into actionable internal tasks, and ensuring updates, follow-ups, and reporting are clear and accurate.



While strategic planning is typically owned in collaboration with Analysts, AMs must have a solid understanding of marketing fundamentals and be comfortable discussing performance results and project objectives. Success in this role requires strong communication, task management skills, and a proactive mindset to keep clients informed and engaged.



AMs are expected to use Slack and Asana regularly to manage projects, collaborate with teams, and communicate with clients. This role is ideal for professionals with marketing exposure and a strong client service foundation who are ready to take the lead on execution and client relationship management.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Client Communication & Relationship Management

Act as the day-to-day contact for assigned clients, ensuring timely responses and clear updates.

Lead recurring client calls, prepare agendas, and document action items and outcomes both internally and externally.

Deliver follow-ups, meeting recaps, and task updates to clients and internal teams using Slack,
, and Asana.

Build rapport with clients and understand their preferences, communication style, and working cadence.



Project Coordination & Task Management

Translate client requests into detailed tasks, coordinating with Analysts, Creative, and SEO teams as needed.

Own the flow of projects in Asana‚Äîsetting due dates, assigning tasks, and following up on progress.

Ensure timelines are met and deliverables meet quality standards before going to the client.

Help keep clients accountable for reviews, feedback, and asset delivery.



Marketing Strategy & Performance Analysis

Understand core marketing metrics and KPIs to speak confidently about campaign trends.

Collaborate with Analysts to prepare insights and recommendations and present them clearly in client-facing updates.

Support campaign planning and optimizations by identifying strategic priorities linked to client goals.

Use tools like TapClicks and GA4 to interpret data and translate results into client-friendly updates.



Account Growth & Retention

Spot growth opportunities through performance review, client feedback, or shifting business needs.

Collaborate with internal leads to scope and pitch upsells or service expansions.

Monitor account health, flag potential churn risks early, and collaborate internally to develop 



Team Collaboration & Internal Best Practices

Work closely with Analysts, SEO, Creative, and leadership to deliver a seamless client experience.

Adhere to SOPs and workflows, maintaining high standards for delivery and communication.

Contribute to process improvement efforts, template development, and mentorship of newer tea
mbers when applicable



Process Improvement & Continuous Learning

Stay current on industry trends, new platform features, and optimization techniques.

Evaluate and test new tools and methodologies to improve campaign performance.

Proactively contribute to improving internal processes, workflow efficiency, and overall team effectiveness.

Share insights and learnings with the broader team to enhance collective knowledge.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



2+ years of experience in a client-facing role, ideally within a marketing agency or digital advertising environment.

Proven success managing accounts, particularly those involving paid media or multi-channel campaigns.

Strong communication skills, including writing client
s and presenting updates in meetings.

Familiarity with Asana (or other PM tools), Slack, and marketing performance dashboards.

Solid understanding of digital marketing channels (e.g., Google Ads, Meta) and common KPIs.

Organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple accounts and timelines simultaneously.

Collaborative mindset and a willingness to ask questions, flag issues, and support team execution.



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS



3+ years of experience in an agency or client services role.

title: Paid Media Account Analyst
description:
ROLE SUMMARY

The Paid Media Account Analyst is a skilled digital marketing professional with 2+ years of hands-on paid ads experience. This role centers on tactical implementation, managing and optimizing multi-channel campaigns across platforms like Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, and programmatic. Account Analysts are expected to take full ownership of campaign execution and performance, confidently managing the day-to-day health of their accounts with minimal oversight. While they collaborate with Senior Account Analysts and Account Managers to shape broader strategy, they are accountable for translating those plans into results. They also play a key role in supporting junior analysts by offering mentorship, feedback, and tactical guidance.



Ideal candidates should be comfortable analyzing performance data, identifying optimization opportunities, and executing media strategies with precision. They should have a solid understanding of cross-channel and full-funnel marketing, enabling them to connect tactical execution with broader client goals. Effective collaboration with account managers and other analysts is essential, as is the ability to clearly communicate results, insights, and tactical recommendations to internal teams.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Campaign Management & Optimization

Build, manage, and optimize paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, Programmatic) independently and with the guidance of senior tea
mbers.

Conduct regular performance analysis, making adjustments to budgets, bids, and targeting to meet KPIs.

Ensure campaigns consistently align with client objectives and strategic guidelines.

Leverage cross-channel insights to optimize the customer journey and maximize ROAS.



Strategic Support & Insight Generation

Execute tactical plans based on strategic guidance from senior analysts and strategists.

Analyze performance data to identify short-term optimization opportunities and tactical improvements.

Provide platform-specific recommendations to enhance campaign performance within established strategic frameworks.



Quality Assurance & Accuracy

Conduct thorough quality assurance checks on campaigns, ensuring correct implementation of tracking and budgets.

Maintain high accuracy and attention to detail across all deliverables.

Correct and proactively address any issues before client delivery.



Team Collaboration & Mentorship

Support junior analysts with tactical execution and platform best practices.

Contribute to onboarding and training initiatives, sharing tactical knowledge regularly.

Foster a collaborative, execution-focused team environment that emphasizes precision and efficiency.



Cross-Functional Communication

Work closely with Account Managers and cross-functional teams to execute campaign tactics effectively.

Clearly communicate performance insights, tactical updates, and optimization recommendations to internal stakeholders.

Participate in client calls when necessary to provide tactical support and platform insights.



Process Improvement & Continuous Learning

Stay current on industry trends, new platform features, and optimization techniques.

Evaluate and test new tools and methodologies to improve campaign performance.

Share insights and learnings with the broader team to enhance collective knowledge.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

2+ years of hands-on experience managing multi-platform paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, programmatic).

Strong grasp of campaign optimization, budget management, and platform-specific best practices.

Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting complex data sets.

Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Proficiency with communication and project management tools (Asana and Slack).



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

3+ years of hands-on experience managing multi-platform paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, programmatic).

Experience managing mid-level accounts or diverse client portfolios across multiple industries.

Proven track record of supporting junior analysts and contributing to team growth.

Certifications such as Google Ads and Meta Blueprint.

Familiarity with niche and growing ad platforms (e.g., Reddit, TikTok, Criteo) or advanced programmatic tools.

title: MOTM: Clean-up Specialist
description:
Job Title: Clean-up Specialist

Location: Remote

Hours: Full-time; 40 hours with at least 6 hours each day overlapping with Eastern Timezone

Compensation: Starting pay: $8/hour (hourly contractor role)

Pay model: Moves to a weekly salary after a successful 90-day review

Annual bonus included (standard)

Apply here: 



About Us

At Money on the Mend, our mission is to bring clarity, order, and confidence to entrepreneurs‚Äîespecially real estate investors and franchise operators‚Äîby delivering streamlined bookkeeping, proactive systems, and financial insight.



We live by our values:

Clarity Over Complexity ‚Äì Simplify financials so clients can see their business story clearly.

Stewardship ‚Äì Treat every dollar‚Äîours and our clients‚Äô‚Äîas a tool for legacy and wise decision-making.

Efficiency & Automation ‚Äì Refuse to do anything twice; we build systems that scale.

Empathy in Action ‚Äì Serve with patience and practicality, shaped by real-world experience.

Team First ‚Äì Build sustainable rhythms and shared success.

Freedom through Focus ‚Äì Create margin for clients, our team, and our families.



We‚Äôre not just reconciling accounts‚Äîwe‚Äôre providing clarity and peace of mind so clients can scale properties, open new locations, and make confident financial decisions.



Role Summary

The Clean-Up Specialist is responsible for supporting and executing client onboarding, setup, and historical clean-up projects, ensuring financial records are accurate, complete, and properly structured before transitioning clients into ongoing monthly bookkeeping.

This role works closely with the Senior Bookkeeper, Marianne Lorduy, to deliver clean, reliable books while maintaining clear communication with both internal tea
mbers and clients throughout the process.



Responsibilities

As a clean-up specialist with Money on the Mend, you will be responsible for:

Client Onboarding, Setup, Clean-Up & Handoff

Lead and support client onboarding, setup, and clean-up projects from intake through completion

Own the Clean-Up ? Ongoing Support handoff, following the handoff SOP to ensure all bookkeeping is complete, accurate, and ready for transition to the Ongoing Support Specialist, in coordination with the Senior Bookkeeper..

Perform historical bookkeeping clean-ups to ensure financial accuracy and completeness

Identify, research, and resolve discrepancies in client books

Ensure books meet Money on the Mend‚Äôs internal quality standards before handoff



Client Communication

Maintain consistent, professional communication with clients during setup and clean-up through our client portal

Track and follow up on required client documentation and access

Clearly communicate status updates, issues, and next steps internally



Process & Documentation

Follow established onboarding, setup, and clean-up workflows

Document issues, edge cases, and process improvements

Support ongoing refinement of onboarding, setup, and clean-up SOPs

Supporting client onboarding with account connections in QBO, Double, Airtable, and client portals.

Collaborating with the manager and team through Slack, Airtable, and Double.



Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone with:

At least one to three years of U.S.-based professional bookkeeping experience.

Two years working with all types of real estate investors or property management (preferred).

Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Double, Airtable, Slack, and Google Workspace.

Strong knowledge of GAAP and best bookkeeping practices.

Preferred: QBO ProAdvisor certification.

Preferred: Intuit Enterprise Suite

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

Strong communication and client-facing ability.

Traits we value: proactive, solutions-oriented, team player, systems thinker.



Work Style & Culture Fit

Comfortable working independently while collaborating closely with a manager.

Able to manage multiple clients, entities, and deadlines.

Values accuracy, clarity, and proactive communication.

Aligns with our belief: financial empowerment comes from clarity, not confusion.



Why Work With Us

Flexible remote work.

Growth opportunities with a lean, tech-forward firm.

Chance to help entrepreneurs, investors, and franchise operators grow wealth and operate confidently.



Our Policy on AI Tools

We recognize that AI and translation tools are widely used by virtual assistants and remote professionals. We believe in being clear about what is acceptable and what is not for this role and interview process:

? Allowed & Encouraged

Drafting, brainstorming, or improving written communication 
s, SOPs, checklists, documentation).

Checking grammar, spelling, or tone for clarity.

Speeding up repetitive tasks or improving efficiency.

Using captions or transcription tools to follow meetings.



?? Limited / Not a Fit

Relying on translation tools for all real-time communication in English. This role requires strong listening comprehension and verbal English without constant translation.

Submitting AI-generated work without editing or adding your own input.

Hiding the use of AI when asked about your process.



???? What to Expect in Hiring

Written and verbal responses will be analyzed for AI-only content.

Interviews will assess live comprehension (your ability to follow spoken English in real time).

Supportive tools are fine‚Äîbut we need to know you can communicate clearly and independently when required.



How to Apply

Please submit:

title: PPC Specialist & Creative ‚Äì Google Search & Meta Ads (Local Service Businesses)
description:
We are a digital marketing agency seeking an experienced PPC Specialist to manage and optimize paid advertising campaigns across Google Search and Meta platforms, as well as independently develop the creative assets that support them. Our clients operate in local service industries including interior remodeling, roofing, landscaping, urgent care, and similar businesses.

What You'll Be Doing

You will be responsible for the full cycle of paid advertising ‚Äî from strategy to execution. This includes keyword research, audience targeting, bid management, performance analysis, and reporting. On the creative side, you will independently develop ad copy and static image assets for Meta campaigns, ensuring visuals and messaging are aligned with each client's brand and designed to drive quality leads.

Requirements

We require a minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience managing Google Search and Meta Ads campaigns, preferably for local service businesses or home services clients. You should also have demonstrated experience producing ad creative independently ‚Äî both compelling copy and static graphics. A strong track record of improving lead quality and reducing cost per lead is essential. Experience with conversion tracking setup and Google Analytics is a plus.

When applying, please include a portfolio or examples of static ad creatives you have designed, alongside campaign results where available.

To Apply

To be considered for this role, please include the following in your application:



A brief summary of 2‚Äì3 Google Search or Meta campaigns you have managed, including the industry, your approach, and the results you achieved. Include any creative samples if available.

Your answer to this question: A local roofing company is spending $3,000/month on Google Search ads but getting low-quality leads. What are the first three things you would investigate or change, and why?



Applications that do not address both items above will not be reviewed.

We are looking for a long-term working relationship with the right candidate. If you have a proven track record in local service paid advertising and creative development, we look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist
description:
Join Our Remote Accounting Team!

We are a fast-growing, boutique outsourced accounting firm supporting high-growth e-commerce and service-based businesses. While our name remains confidential for now, we‚Äôve been behind the scenes helping some of the most exciting DTC brands scale with confidence through expert bookkeeping, financial systems, and strategic insights.



We are a remote-first company with a collaborative, client-first culture ‚Äî and we‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.



We are seeking a detail-oriented Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist to own inventory accuracy, valuation, and reconciliation within our ERP environment for a fast-growing e-commerce business.



About the Role

The Senior Inventory Accounting Specialist sits at the intersection of accounting and operations, ensuring inventory data is complete, accurate, and properly valued to support reliable COGS, financial reporting, and month-end close. The ideal candidate is comfortable working independently, digging into variances, and partnering cross-functionally to resolve issues efficiently.



Core Responsibilities

**Inventory Recording & Accuracy

- Manage inventory transactions within an ERP system (Finaloop or comparable platforms such as NetSuite), including purchases, sales, returns, write-offs, and transfers

- Maintain perpetual inventory records and ensure alignment between operational data and the general ledger

- Review supporting documentation to validate accuracy across warehouses and distribution channels



**Inventory Valuation & Landed Costs

- Calculate and maintain landed costs, including freight, duties, and handling fees

- Ensure inventory is valued consistently using approved valuation methods and aligned with accounting standards

- Support reserves and adjustments for obsolete, slow-moving, or damaged inventory in coordination with Finance and Operations



**Reconciliations & Variance Resolution

- Perform regular inventory reconciliations between ERP, accounting records, and physical counts

- Investigate discrepancies and document root causes, partnering with operations and warehouse teams to resolve issues

- Ensure accurate cost allocations and transfers across systems



**COGS & Financial Reporting Support

- Support accurate calculation of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) for monthly close

- Prepare inventory-related schedules, reconciliations, and supporting documentation

- Assist Finance leadership with inventory analyses, reporting, and audit support as needed



**Systems, Tools & Analysis

- Utilize ERP and reporting tools to analyze inventory movements and trends

- Build and maintain Excel-based reports using advanced formulas and pivot tables (Power Query is a plus)

- Support data extraction and validation from distributor or fulfillment platforms when applicable



Qualifications

- 4‚Äì7 years of experience in accounting and inventory management, inventory accounting, or cost accounting

- Hands-on experience with ERP systems such as Finaloop, NetSuite, or similar platforms

- Strong understanding of ecommerce inventory flows, landed costs, and cost allocations

- Solid knowledge of inventory accounting principles and COGS

- Advanced Excel skills (LOOKUPs, Pivot Tables; Power Query a plus)

- Ability to work independently, investigate issues, and follow through to resolution



Why Join Accountally?

- Competitive Pay of $11 - $12/hr with performance-based growth opportunities

- Paid Time Off

- A Culture of Collaboration & Excellence built around service, innovation, and personal development

- Clear path to Accounting Manager within 12 - 24 months of employment

description:

title: Production & AR Specialist- Roofing
description:
Offer

Standard Legal Philippine Employment

Various company initiated incentive programs

Division bonuses 



About the Role:

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented, process-driven, and resourceful professional to support our production operations in the roofing industry.



This role plays a critical part in ensuring projects move from contract to completion without costly delays, compliance issues, or revenue gaps. You will be responsible for material ordering, work orders, roof drawings, inspection scheduling, permit verification and processing, and accounts receivable follow-up, particularly insurance-related collections.



This position requires laser-sharp attention to detail. A single oversight, such as failing to secure a required permit, can result in fines, penalties, or project delays. Accuracy, ownership, and consistent follow-through are absolutely essential.



If you thrive in structured processes, enjoy verifying information thoroughly, and take pride in operational excellence, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Production Coordination

Create and manage work orders for roofing projects

Order materials accurately and on time based on project specifications

Coordinate with suppliers to confirm availability and delivery schedules

Prepare and review roof drawings and measurements (EagleView, Hover, or similar tools preferred)

Schedule city and final inspections

Maintain accurate production timelines and internal documentation

Communicate with project managers and field teams to ensure alignment



2. Permitting & Compliance

Identify whether permits are required for each project

Contact city offices or municipal departments to verify requirements

Submit and process permit applications accurately

Track permit approvals and inspection schedules

Maintain documentation for compliance records

Ensure no project begins without required approvals

Monitor changes in city requirements and update internal processes



Note: Failure to secure required permits can result in fines or fees ‚Äî this role demands precision and accountability.



3. Accounts Receivable & Insurance Follow-Up

Track all outstanding balances for roofing projects

Follow up with insurance companies to ensure depreciation checks are released on time

Monitor claim status and document communications

Contact homeowners regarding payment schedules

Follow proper cadence for collections on insurance jobs

Maintain detailed and organized tracking systems

Coordinate with internal accounting team to reconcile payments

Escalate payment delays appropriately



4. Communication & Cross-Department Coordination

Communicate clearly with:

- Insurance adjusters

- City permit offices

- Suppliers

- Homeowners

- Project managers

- Accounts team

Provide accurate updates internally and externally

Escalate potential compliance or payment risks early

Maintain professionalism when discussing collections



Requirements:

Experience in roofing, construction operations, or production coordination

Strong understanding of permit processes (city-level preferred)

Experience handling accounts receivable or collections

Familiarity with insurance claim processes (especially depreciation recovery)

Exceptional attention to detail and documentation accuracy

Highly organized and process-oriented

Strong follow-up discipline, nothing falls through the cracks

Confident and professional phone communication skills

Ability to verify information independently (resourceful and proactive)

Comfortable tracking multiple projects simultaneously



Preferred:

Experience in the roofing industry (highly preferred)

Familiarity with homeowner‚Äôs  insurance restoration jobs

Experience working with U.S. municipalities (if applicable)

Knowledge of CRM systems and production tracking software

Experience using roof measurement tools (EagleView, Hover, etc.)

Basic understanding of construction timelines and workflows



What Success Looks Like:

Zero missed permits

No compliance-related fines or preventable delays

Materials ordered accurately and on schedule

Inspections scheduled without bottlenecks

Consistent and documented insurance follow-up

Timely release of depreciation checks

Minimal outstanding receivables beyond expected timelines

Clear, organized tracking systems

Strong internal communication with production and accounting teams

Homeowners feel informed and professionally handled
