title: Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager
description:
Position: Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager



Department: Amazon Global Operations

Location: Remote Work

Shift Timings: EST Time Zone



About CBAYEXPRESS / Herbishh

CBAYEXPRESS CORPORATION is a Canadian-based e-commerce company with $15M+ annual revenue, selling across Amazon (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU, SG, IN, UAE), Walmart, Shopify, and other marketplaces.



Our flagship brand Herbishh is a leader in haircare and personal care, with aggressive expansion in global markets. Amazon is our primary growth channel, and smooth operations are critical for scaling.



Role Overview

The Amazon Operations & Compliance Manager will oversee all day-to-day operational and compliance activities in Amazon Seller Central across multiple marketplaces. This role ensures that listings remain active, compliant, and optimized, while also managing reimbursements, case resolutions, and policy adherence.



This position will free up Brand Managers to focus on growth and strategy, while ensuring Amazon operations run seamlessly in the background.



Key Responsibilities

1. Listing & Catalog Management

   - Manage all Amazon listing operations: flat file uploads, parent-child variations, attribute updates.

   - Monitor and resolve suppressed, stranded, and inactive ASINs daily.

   - Maintain brand registry submissions and ensure consistency across marketplaces.

2. Compliance & Policy Management

   - Monitor and address compliance issues (keywords, claims, DG/Hazmat flags).

   - Work closely with Regulatory Affairs team (Senior Manager, Arunima, Sohel) to submit required documents (SDS, COA, HRIPT, etc.).

   - Proactively prevent suspensions and policy violations.

3. Reimbursements & Cost Recovery

   - File and track FBA reimbursement claims for lost/damaged inventory and fee overcharges.

   - Audit discrepancies in shipments and ensure compensation.

   - Use tools like Helium10 Refund Genie, Sellerboard, or manual audits.

4. Case & Issue Management

   - Own the Amazon case log ‚Äì raise, escalate, and resolve support tickets.

   - Track response times and push for faster resolutions.

   - Maintain an issue tracker with clear visibility for Brand Managers and leadership.

5. Cross-Functional Coordination

   - Work with Inventory team on shipment reconciliation.

   - Support PPC Managers by ensuring listings remain ad-eligible.

   - Assist Brand Managers in smooth product launches by handling back-end uploads and approvals.



KPIs / Success Metrics

   - % of listings active with zero suppression/inactivity.

   - Value of reimbursements recovered from Amazon (target: $50K‚Äì100K+ annually).

   - Average resolution time for Amazon cases.

   - Zero major account suspensions or policy violations.

   - On-time support for new product launches.



Requirements

   - 3‚Äì5 years experience in Amazon Seller Central operations & compliance.

   - Strong knowledge of flat files, brand registry, listing troubleshooting.

   - Experience filing and tracking reimbursements (Helium10/Sellerboard preferred).

   - Excellent organizational skills & attention to detail.

   - Ability to manage multiple marketplaces (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU).

   - Strong communication skills for Amazon case escalations.



Nice-to-Have

   - Experience with Walmart Seller Center operations.

   - Familiarity with e-commerce compliance workflows (SDS, COA, DG).

   - Worked with $10M+ Amazon accounts previously.



What We Offer

   - Competitive salary

   - Opportunity to manage operations for a multi-million-dollar Amazon account.

   - Direct impact on business profitability via reimbursements & issue prevention.

   - Growth path to Senior Amazon Operations Manager as team expands.

title: Chief Operating Officer (COO) / Integrator
description:
Position: COO / Integrator (Second-in-Command)



Department: Executive Operations

Reports to: CEO & Director

Employment Type: Full-time



About CBAYEXPRESS / Herbishh

CBAYEXPRESS CORPORATION is a Canadian-based e-commerce company with multi-market presence across Amazon (US, CA, MX, UK, EU, AU, SG, IN, UAE), Walmart, Shopify (
, 
), eBay, Etsy, and more.

Our flagship brand Herbishh leads in hair care & personal care, with revenues exceeding CAD 15M annually, and we are scaling rapidly towards CAD 20M+ in global sales.



With 40+ employees across Canada, India, and the Philippines, we are now hiring a COO/Integrator to streamline operations, enforce accountability, and scale the company to its next phase of growth.



Role Overview

The COO will act as the Integrator (EOS model) and second-in-command to the CEO, ensuring that vision translates into execution. They will oversee cross-functional teams (Amazon, Shopify/D2C, Inventory, Finance, HR, Regulatory, and Customer Success) and enforce SOPs, KPIs, and operational discipline.



This is a hands-on leadership role, ideal for someone who has scaled an e-commerce business from $10M ? $30M+ and knows how to align global teams across multiple marketplaces.



Key Responsibilities

1. Leadership & Alignment

‚Ä¢ Translate CEO‚Äôs vision into executable quarterly/annual plans.

‚Ä¢ Manage and mentor Department Heads (Amazon, D2C, Inventory, Finance, Marketing, HR).

‚Ä¢ Run weekly leadership meetings with clear scorecards, KPIs, and accountability.

2. Operational Excellence

‚Ä¢ Drive operational efficiency across Canada, India, PH, and Mexico teams.

title: Underwriting Technician (Data Analyst)
description:
PLEASE FILL OUT THIS GOOGLE FORM TO START AN APPLICATION RIGHT AWAY: 



About us:

With over 100 years of combined industry experience, the Community Minerals team specializes in the purchase of mineral or royalty rights all over the US. We have earned a stellar reputation with hundreds of satisfied customers and an ‚ÄúA‚Äù Rating with the Better Business Bureau. With our proven track record, we continue to serve mineral owners in several states with transparency, accountability, and a personalized experience to meet individual needs.



Job Summary:

The Underwriting Technician supports the Underwriting Team by managing data entry, documentation preparation, and technical file organization for acquisition evaluations. The role ensures that all inputs required by Underwriters are accurate, complete, and delivered in a timely and compliant manner. This position directly contributes to the operational efficiency of the Reserves and Underwriting Closing Teams by handling structured, detail-oriented tasks that enable faster deal turnaround and technical standardization.



Job Description:

- Parse, clean, and format large volumes of production and well data (e.g., API numbers, well names).

- Enter data accurately into Excel and other tools based on predefined templates and formats.

- Verify data completeness and identify/correct discrepancies before submission to Underwriters.

- Maintain documentation related to internal and marketed deals, ensuring proper file structure and version control.

- Coordinate with Underwriters to ensure timely access to technical inputs and documentation.

- Assist in the setup of evaluation folders and documentation workflows.

- Support the Reserves Team and the Underwriting Closing Team with operational requirements.

- Follow and enforce documentation standards and internal data protocols.

- Maintain digital records and contribute to improving template accuracy and process consistency.



Qualifications:

Education:

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree or college coursework in Petroleum Engineering, Geosciences, Energy Studies, Information Management, or a related technical or administrative field.



Experience:

- 1 to 2 years of experience in data entry, technical documentation, or administrative support, ideally in a technical or energy-related environment.



Technical Skills:

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (sorting, formatting, formulas, and basic data validation).

- Familiarity with large dataset handling, template-driven documentation, and digital file organization.

- Knowledge of oil and gas production data, well naming conventions, and API identifiers is an advantage.

- Comfortable using digital file systems, shared folders, and version-controlled workspaces.



Soft Skills:

- High attention to detail and consistency in data handling.

- Strong organizational and time management skills.

- Clear written and verbal communication.

- Ability to collaborate with cross-functional tea
mbers remotely.

- Dependable, responsive, and structured in task execution.



Industry Knowledge:

- Basic understanding of oil and gas production workflows and mineral acquisition data.

- Familiarity with mineral rights, well structures, or technical records is a plus.

- Awareness of regulatory standards for documentation in the energy or mineral sectors is beneficial.





What's in it for You:

- Competitive Compensation: Earn $3.18/hr to $3.55/hr paid in U.S. Dollars, commensurate with your skills and experience.

- Work your way: Remote Work Set-Up enabling you to operate from the comfort and convenience of your own chosen workspace

- Flexible Healthcare Bonus (Philippines): A healthcare bonus you control. Use it for HMO coverage, life insurance, or set it aside as an emergency fund‚Äîwhatever best supports your well-being. It‚Äôs entirely up to you.

- Success Incentives: Enjoy company bonuses and performance-driven rewards.

- Soar with Us: Opportunities for career growth and promotions await you.

- Positive Vibes Only: Experience a supportive and uplifting work culture.

- Annual Bonus: We value your dedication throughout the year, rewarding you with an annual performance bonus shared at the end of the year.

- Performance Raise: Your hard work doesn't go unnoticed. Be ready to seize opportunities for a salary increase based on your outstanding performance.

- Performance Incentives: We believe exceptional work deserves recognition. Performance incentives are awarded to individuals who demonstrate outstanding contributions, initiative, and results. It‚Äôs our way of celebrating excellence and motivating continued success.

- Discretionary Bonus: At Community Minerals, exceptional work doesn‚Äôt go unnoticed. Contractors who consistently go above and beyond may be rewarded with discretionary bonuses, a token of appreciation for outstanding contributions, impactful results, and dedication to excellence. Let your work speak, and the rewards will follow!



System Requirements

To ensure optimal performance and functionality while using different web and application tools, please make sure that your syste
ets the following requirements:



Operating System:

- Windows: Windows 10 (64-bit) or higher

- macOS: macOS 11 (Big Sur) or higher



Processor:

- Intel: 8th Gen Core i3, i5, i7, or newer

- AMD: Ryzen 3 (2018) or newer



Memory (RAM):

- Minimum: 8 GB RAM

- Recommended: 16 GB RAM for multitasking and optimal performance

About us

Job Summary:



We are seeking a dedicated Prescription Navigator to join our healthcare team. Squad Health offers navigation services and software to patients of medical practices to remove barriers to treatment, particularly prescription access. Check status of pending authorizations and continue to work these.

STAT orders will require immediate, urgent attention.

Participate in tea
etings to problem solve patient issues, and improve company operations on behalf of patients and partner practices

title: Provider Credentialing & Insurance Enrollment Specialist
description:
About Us

Insightful Enterprises, PLLC dba Insightful Psychiatry is a multi-state telepsychiatry group practice dedicated to expanding access to high-quality mental health care. We are rapidly onboarding new psychiatric providers and are seeking an experienced Credentialing & Enrollment Specialist to manage payer enrollment and ensure our clinicians are in-network to provide care.



Position Overview

The Credentialing & Enrollment Specialist will be responsible for managing all aspects of insurance enrollment and credentialing for our group NPI and individual providers. The ideal candidate has direct experience with commercial insurance payers and CAQH management, and can work independently to ensure timely and accurate enrollment.



Key Responsibilities

Manage credentialing and enrollment for new providers (PMHNPs, psychiatrists, etc.) across multiple states.

Maintain and update group and individual CAQH profiles, NPPES (NPI-1 & NPI-2), and payer portals.

Submit enrollment and recredentialing applications to insurance companies.

Track credentialing status, follow up with payers, and resolve application delays or issues.

Ensure compliance with payer requirements, delegated credentialing agreements, and practice standards.

Assist in adding new service locations and maintaining group contracts.

Coordinate with providers to collect necessary documents (licenses, malpractice insurance, CVs, etc.).

Provide regular updates and reporting to practice leadership.



Qualifications

2+ years of experience in insurance credentialing and enrollment (psychiatry/behavioral health experience preferred).

Strong knowledge of CAQH, NPPES, and payer enrollment workflows.

Experience with private/commercial insurance credentialing

Detail-oriented, highly organized, and proactive with follow-ups.

Ability to work independently in a remote setting.



Supportive, collaborative team environment.



How to Apply

Please submit your resume  highlighting your credentialing and insurance enrollment experience with multi-state medical practices.

title: Podcast & Social Media Assistant ‚Äì SOBERSYNQ Recovery Platform (Work With Celebrity Host)
description:
ABOUT OUR ORGANIZATION

SOBERSYNQ (S-Y-N-Q) is a U.S.‚Äìbased 501(c)(3) nonprofit building a full digital recovery ecosystem. We provide people in sobriety with modern, accessible tools including:

The podcast is recorded in Palm Springs, California and hosted by Ben Patrick Johnson, a well-known actor, narrator, activist, and humanitarian.

title: Monarch Money Budget Manager (Direct Monarch Experience Required)
description:
Part-Time Personal Budget Manager | Remote | ~5‚Äì8 hrs/month (1-2 hrs/week)



I‚Äôm looking for a detail-oriented budget manager with direct, hands-on Monarch Money experience to help my wife and me clean up, structure, and improve our financial system. I am not strong with budgeting and financial management and am looking for someone who can patiently help me. The goal is clarity, simplicity, and long-term confidence in how we manage income, royalties, and small business cash flow ‚Äî not just bookkeeping. 



What You‚Äôll Help With:

- Cleaning up and properly structuring our Monarch setup

- Creating clean category systems and rules

- Managing royalty income correctly

- Handling transfers between accounts properly

- Organizing two very small side businesses inside our budget

- Building a simple monthly review framework

- Teaching me how to confidently manage Monarch myself



This is both implementation and coaching. I want someone who can build structure and explain why it works.



Our Financial Situation:

- W-2 income

- Royalty income

- Two small side businesses (minimal income currently)

- Desire to better manage savings, allocation, and long-term planning



Tax awareness is a strong bonus ‚Äî especially experience with royalties or small business income ‚Äî but CPA status is not required.



Work Structure & Expectations:

Most work can be done on your own schedule.

We will schedule a consistent weekly ~30-minute video call to:

- Review the budget

- Discuss financial planning adjustments

- Clarify questions

- Set next steps



I value clarity, preparation, and 
ntum in these meetings. I want someone who comes ready with insights and suggestions ‚Äî not just updates.



What Success Looks Like:

- Monarch is clean, organized, and sustainable

- Income streams are categorized properly

- We have clarity on cash flow and goals

- Monthly review is simple and effective

- I feel confident managing the system long-term



Bonuses: 

- Small Business Budgeting or Tax Planning

- Experience handling royalty income (especially oil and gas)

- Financial Planning & Strategy

- Notion Experience (for documentation and task coordination)



Compensation:

$8‚Äì12/hr ‚Äì Strong Monarch experience

$12‚Äì18/hr ‚Äì If you also have small business budgeting or tax planning experience



To Apply

Please include:

- How long you‚Äôve used Monarch

- Specific examples of budgets you‚Äôve structured inside Monarch

- Whether you‚Äôve worked with royalty income or small business budgeting



Applications without confirmed Monarch experience will not be considered. Thank you!
